Based on the search results, here's a comparison of Hetzner vs Scaleway cloud hosting and VPS pricing in 2026:

## Company Overviews

**Hetzner:**
Hetzner Online GmbH is a German internet service provider based in Gunzenhausen, employing around 306 people as of 2021. The company was founded in 1997 by Martin Hetzner. Its services include dedicated servers, cloud solutions, web hosting, domain registration, and colocation services in data centers located in Germany, Finland, and the U.S.

**Scaleway:**
Scaleway is a cloud computing provider with data centers in Paris, Amsterdam, and Warsaw. It offers managed services for bare metal, containerization, and serverless architectures, with a focus on multi-cloud support and renewable energy-powered infrastructure. Over the years, Scaleway has introduced innovations such as ARM-based cloud computing, Kubernetes services, and Europe's first AI supercomputer.

## Pricing Comparison

**Hetzner:**
- Hetzner Cloud is a favorite among European developers for one simple reason: very strong price to performance. It is a no-nonsense cloud hosting provider offering virtual servers, storage, and networking at prices that are often significantly lower than US-based competitors.
- Hetzner offers a wide range of hosting plans at competitive prices, with options for dedicated servers, cloud hosting, and virtual private servers (VPS). Their pricing is straightforward, and they do not charge for traffic within the same data center.

**Scaleway:**
- Scaleway is a cloud hosting provider based in France that offers inexpensive virtual private servers, cloud servers, object storage, and more. Their VPS and cloud servers start at around $2.99 per month making them one of the most affordable options.
- Scaleway offers a wide range of products, from tiny "Stardust" instances (under ‚Ç¨1/month) to high-performance GPU and bare-metal servers.
- Scaleway provides cost-effective options with hourly billing for their cloud instances, making it suitable for flexible workloads and better control over costs.

## Key Differences

**Data Center Locations:**
- Hetzner has several data centers spread across Europe, including in Germany and Finland. In contrast, Scaleway has data centers located in France, the Netherlands, and Poland, which may suit customers looking for specific geographic regions.

**Scalability:**
- Hetzner focuses more on traditional dedicated servers and VPS, which can be scaled up or down as per the requirements. Scaleway, with its cloud infrastructure, offers the advantage of quick scalability and flexibility with the ability to provision cloud instances on-demand and adjust resources in real-time.

**Customer Support:**
- Hetzner is known for comprehensive customer support, offering 24/7 assistance via multiple channels, including live chat, email, and phone support. Scaleway provides support through their community forum, ticketing system, and a dedicated knowledge base, though the availability of direct support options like live chat may vary depending on the chosen plan.

**Additional Features:**
- Hetzner offers various additional features, such as managed backup solutions, domain registration services, and SSL certificates. Scaleway provides additional offerings like object storage, Kubernetes as a Service, container registry, and managed databases.

## Best For

- Choose Hetzner Cloud if you want maximum performance per euro and are comfortable handling your own server management. Hetzner covers the "lean but powerful" corner of the map.

- Scaleway works well for budget-conscious startups that still want proper cloud hosting services rather than a basic VPS. The platform is easier to reason about than a full hyperscaler, yet powerful enough to host production workloads. Free egress, low entry price points, and dev-focused instance families make it attractive if you are building in Europe.

# TADA-PROJECT
> R√©f√©rence Moltbot pour l'√©volution de TADA

## Objectif

Analyser l'architecture de Moltbot (ex-Clawdbot) pour s'en inspirer dans l'√©volution de TADA ‚Äî notamment sur :
- Structure des instructions agent (SOUL, AGENTS, TOOLS)
- Syst√®me de m√©moire (daily logs + long-term memory)
- Heartbeats et proactivit√©
- Skills modulaires

## Source

- **Repo** : [moltbot/moltbot](https://github.com/moltbot/moltbot)
- **Docs** : [docs.molt.bot](https://docs.molt.bot)
- **Stars** : 60k+ (janvier 2026)
- **Cr√©ateur** : Peter Steinberger (@steipete)

---

## Statut

En cours d'analyse

## √Ä faire

- [ ] Lire les templates (SOUL, AGENTS, TOOLS)
- [ ] Identifier les patterns applicables √† TADA
- [ ] Comparer avec la structure actuelle de `_SYSTEM/`

## Questions

- Comment int√©grer les heartbeats dans TADA ?
- Faut-il s√©parer SOUL.md de CLAUDE.md ?

---

## Structure des dossiers

```
TADA-PROJECT/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.md
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ docs/
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ CLAUDE.md              ‚Üê Guidelines d√©veloppeurs
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ templates/
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AGENTS.md          ‚Üê Template workspace agent
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AGENTS.default.md  ‚Üê Config assistant personnel
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ SOUL.md            ‚Üê Personnalit√© / identit√©
    ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ TOOLS.md           ‚Üê Notes outils locaux
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ concepts/
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agent.md           ‚Üê Runtime agent
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agent-workspace.md ‚Üê Structure workspace
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ system-prompt.md   ‚Üê Assemblage du prompt
    ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ acp-bridge.md      ‚Üê Agent Client Protocol
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ skills/
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ obsidian.md        ‚Üê Exemple skill Obsidian
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ github.md          ‚Üê Exemple skill GitHub
```

## Fichiers

| Fichier | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| [CLAUDE.md](docs/CLAUDE.md) | Guidelines repo (multi-agent, commits, PR) |
| [AGENTS.md](docs/templates/AGENTS.md) | Template comportement agent |
| [SOUL.md](docs/templates/SOUL.md) | Template personnalit√© |
| [agent-workspace.md](docs/concepts/agent-workspace.md) | Structure workspace compl√®te |

## Notes

### Concepts cl√©s de Moltbot

**Workspace = cerveau de l'agent**
- `AGENTS.md` ‚Äî instructions op√©rationnelles
- `SOUL.md` ‚Äî personnalit√©, ton, limites
- `TOOLS.md` ‚Äî notes sp√©cifiques √† l'environnement
- `memory/` ‚Äî logs quotidiens
- `MEMORY.md` ‚Äî m√©moire long-terme curat√©e

**Heartbeats = proactivit√©**
- L'agent v√©rifie p√©riodiquement (emails, calendar, etc.)
- R√©pond `HEARTBEAT_OK` si rien √† signaler
- Peut faire du travail en arri√®re-plan

**Skills = comportements modulaires**
- Chaque skill a un `SKILL.md`
- Charg√© √† la demande quand n√©cessaire
- S√©paration claire instructions / notes locales

### Diff√©rences avec TADA actuel

| Aspect | TADA | Moltbot |
|--------|------|---------|
| Instructions | `CLAUDE.md` unique | Split en SOUL + AGENTS + TOOLS |
| M√©moire | `local/logs.md` | `memory/` (daily) + `MEMORY.md` (curated) |
| Proactivit√© | Routines manuelles | Heartbeats automatiques |
| Skills | Int√©gr√© dans CLAUDE.md | Fichiers SKILL.md s√©par√©s |

## Hetzner vs Scaleway pour Moltbot + TADA

### Ma recommandation : **Hetzner**

| Crit√®re | Hetzner | Scaleway |
|---------|---------|----------|
| **Prix entr√©e** | **3,49‚Ç¨/mois** (2 CPU, 4GB RAM) | 4,99‚Ç¨/mois (1 CPU, 4GB RAM) |
| **Rapport perf/prix** | **Meilleur** | Correct |
| **Simplicit√©** | **VPS direct, pas de fioritures** | Plus de services manag√©s |
| **GPU (si LLM local)** | ‚ùå Non | ‚úÖ H100 disponible |
| **Datacenters** | üá©üá™ üá´üáÆ üá∫üá∏ | üá´üá∑ üá≥üá± üáµüá± |
| **Services manag√©s** | Basic | K8s, object storage, DBaaS |

### Pourquoi Hetzner pour ton cas

# TADA-PROJECT
> R√©f√©rence Moltbot pour l'√©volution de TADA

## Objectif

Analyser l'architecture de Moltbot (ex-Clawdbot) pour s'en inspirer dans l'√©volution de TADA ‚Äî notamment sur :
- Structure des instructions agent (SOUL, AGENTS, TOOLS)
- Syst√®me de m√©moire (daily logs + long-term memory)
- Heartbeats et proactivit√©
- Skills modulaires

## Source

- **Repo** : [moltbot/moltbot](https://github.com/moltbot/moltbot)
- **Docs** : [docs.molt.bot](https://docs.molt.bot)
- **Stars** : 60k+ (janvier 2026)
- **Cr√©ateur** : Peter Steinberger (@steipete)

---

## Statut

En cours d'analyse

## √Ä faire

- [ ] Lire les templates (SOUL, AGENTS, TOOLS)
- [ ] Identifier les patterns applicables √† TADA
- [ ] Comparer avec la structure actuelle de `_SYSTEM/`

## Questions

- Comment int√©grer les heartbeats dans TADA ?
- Faut-il s√©parer SOUL.md de CLAUDE.md ?

---

## Structure des dossiers

```
TADA-PROJECT/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ index.md
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ docs/
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ CLAUDE.md              ‚Üê Guidelines d√©veloppeurs
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ templates/
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AGENTS.md          ‚Üê Template workspace agent
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ AGENTS.default.md  ‚Üê Config assistant personnel
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ SOUL.md            ‚Üê Personnalit√© / identit√©
    ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ TOOLS.md           ‚Üê Notes outils locaux
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ concepts/
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agent.md           ‚Üê Runtime agent
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ agent-workspace.md ‚Üê Structure workspace
    ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ system-prompt.md   ‚Üê Assemblage du prompt
    ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ acp-bridge.md      ‚Üê Agent Client Protocol
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ skills/
        ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ obsidian.md        ‚Üê Exemple skill Obsidian
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ github.md          ‚Üê Exemple skill GitHub
```

## Fichiers

| Fichier | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| [CLAUDE.md](docs/CLAUDE.md) | Guidelines repo (multi-agent, commits, PR) |
| [AGENTS.md](docs/templates/AGENTS.md) | Template comportement agent |
| [SOUL.md](docs/templates/SOUL.md) | Template personnalit√© |
| [agent-workspace.md](docs/concepts/agent-workspace.md) | Structure workspace compl√®te |

## Notes

### Concepts cl√©s de Moltbot

**Workspace = cerveau de l'agent**
- `AGENTS.md` ‚Äî instructions op√©rationnelles
- `SOUL.md` ‚Äî personnalit√©, ton, limites
- `TOOLS.md` ‚Äî notes sp√©cifiques √† l'environnement
- `memory/` ‚Äî logs quotidiens
- `MEMORY.md` ‚Äî m√©moire long-terme curat√©e

**Heartbeats = proactivit√©**
- L'agent v√©rifie p√©riodiquement (emails, calendar, etc.)
- R√©pond `HEARTBEAT_OK` si rien √† signaler
- Peut faire du travail en arri√®re-plan

**Skills = comportements modulaires**
- Chaque skill a un `SKILL.md`
- Charg√© √† la demande quand n√©cessaire
- S√©paration claire instructions / notes locales

### Diff√©rences avec TADA actuel

| Aspect | TADA | Moltbot |
|--------|------|---------|
| Instructions | `CLAUDE.md` unique | Split en SOUL + AGENTS + TOOLS |
| M√©moire | `local/logs.md` | `memory/` (daily) + `MEMORY.md` (curated) |
| Proactivit√© | Routines manuelles | Heartbeats automatiques |
| Skills | Int√©gr√© dans CLAUDE.md | Fichiers SKILL.md s√©par√©s |
